docs.text: i think that any competent member of the human race who's ever seen a movie--any movie--could probably predict just about every turn in the wedding singer .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: even though i try very hard to not predict films as i'm watching them ( especially not romantic comedies ) , the plot of this particular film just advanced before me seconds , and sometimes minutes , before i actually saw it happen on screen .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but i don't care .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: not even a little .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: my reasons for this are simple : 1 ) adam sandler is great .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: 2 ) drew barrymore is great .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: 3 ) the movie is so funny .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there are parts that left me gasping for air because i was laughing so hard .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i haven't laughed this hard in a movie since austin powers .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: sandler plays robby hart , a wedding singer who once had dreams of being in a rock band and writing his own music .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in the opening scenes , he seems like a happy-go-lucky wedding singer , at least partially enjoying his profession and doing a rather good job of talking down a really drunk individual ( steve buscemi ) who decides that his brother's wedding is a good place to tell the whole world that his life , up to that point , was utter pointlessness .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: a week later , at his own wedding , he is left standing at the altar by his ex-fianc ? e , linda ( angela featherstone ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: with his life in complete disarray , he meets julia ( barrymore ) , a waitress .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: she is engaged to glenn ( matthew glave ) , and is to marry him in about three months .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: julia and robby become good friends when she enlists him to help with the wedding plans .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: soon ( and predictably ) it becomes pretty clear that glenn is a jerk , and that robby and julia really love each other .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: oh sure , it's trite .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and if anyone making this film expected us to , like , feel suspense or something while watching the wedding singer , then they truly underestimated their audience .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: what makes the story bearable , aside from the terrific costumes and 80s music , are the performances .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: barrymore is simply adorable here ( i've never seen her look so close to the way she did in et ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: not only is she pleasant to look at , but her acting job here really is a good one--and it doesn't hurt that the character is likable and adequately well-written .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and the jerk , played in full-force by graves , is just as despicable as any villain in any romantic comedy i've ever seen .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: naturally , the true star here is sandler .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i think the guy is flat-out hilarious .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he can say something that just isn't funny , and his delivery makes me laugh .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: his comedic performance here equals that of happy gilmore , but in this film he goes much further and proves to me that he can , indeed , hold his own as a leading man in a romantic comedy .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: whereas his roles in his previous films kind of had sandler playing sandler , the wedding singer gives him a character that , for the first time , he actually has to fit into .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: as far as i'm concerned he succeeded , and this film is testimony that he does , in fact , have some range in his talents .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and the movie is just so funny .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: perhaps the best moment is when he sings a song for julia that he claims is a little uneven because he began writing it while in a good mood and finished it after his fianc ? e abandoned him .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this is the part that literally had me groping for a breath of air .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and while the film , like all romantic comedies , takes a hiatus from laughs towards the end because the plot has to finish up , there are more than enough truly hilarious moments in the first hour that make up for any slumps in progress during the second half .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: my formal complaints for the wedding singer aren't very important .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the film is predicable , but who cares ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the characters are extremely likable , the movie is ridiculously funny , and the experience is simply enjoyable .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in addition to this , i can't imagine anyone seeing the preview and not wanting to see the film .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in that order , i conclude that it is pointless for me to even have written this review .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i just want everyone to know that i laughed .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: a lot .
docs.label: positive
